snippet: Every year since the early 1900’s, a tower has been erected in a festival honoring St. Anthony of Padua, a tradition that has endured even as many Italians moved out of the neighborhood.
abstract: Italian-Americans have gathered in East Harlem each year since the early 1900s to build and lift a large tower in honor of St Anthony of Padua, even after may Italian residents moved out of area around upper East 100s, once one of New York's largest Italian neighborhoods.
lead_paragraph: Every year since the early 1900’s, a tower has been erected in a festival honoring St. Anthony of Padua, a tradition that has endured even as many Italians moved out of the neighborhood.

headline.main: Italian-Americans Return to East Harlem So That St. Anthony’s Tower Can Rise Again
headline.print_headline: Italian-Americans Return to East Harlem So That St. Anthony’s Tower Can Rise Again
